points to an element which encodes the starting position of the text corresponding to the inscribed part of the surface.

remarks.p: The surface element represents an imaged area of any physical surface forming part of the source material. This may be a sheet of paper, one face of a monument, a billboard, a papyrus scroll, or indeed any 2-dimensional surface.

The co-ordinate space defined by this elements may be thought of as a grid xMax units wide and yMax units high. This grid is superimposed on the whole of the image indicated by the first child graphic of the surface. If the box is supplied, its values indicate the part of this grid which is understood to contain the whole of the surface being described; if it is not supplied, then the implication is that the surface maps exactly onto the image.
